It's not that simple as nested types (e.g row) could contain doubles too.
Let's whitelist types for which min/max optimization works (e.g numeric types, timestamps, character strings,...)

For nested types there is no failure in the query like in #4272
We are able to create TupleDomain out of an array of Double.NaN as isFloatingPointNaN does not look into nested types. So I think for nested types, this change probably doesn't make the situation any worse.
do we need to set it here? There is no corresponding test
